definition: to decide/to determine/to execute (sb)/(of a dam etc) to breach or burst/definitely/certainly
abbr. for the Big Dipper constellation 北斗星[Bei3 dou3 xing1]
to fight/to struggle/to condemn/to censure/to contend/to put together/coming together
dry measure for grain equal to ten 升[sheng1] or one-tenth of a 石[dan4]/decaliter/peck/cup or dipper shaped object/old variant of 陡[dou3]

sentences.english: The two dueled, transforming the office of politics into an arena of lightsaber combat.
sentences.chinese: 他们俩展开决斗，把政府办公室变成光剑格斗场。

sentences.english: Who is to fight Wickham, and make him marry her, if he comes away?
sentences.chinese: 他一走，还有谁去跟韦翰决斗，逼着他跟丽迪雅结婚？

sentences.english: As Voldemort, defeat Harry Potter in Duelling Club.
sentences.chinese: 在决斗俱乐部中以伏地魔战胜哈利波特。

sentences.english: In one of his numerous duels he had the misfortune to kill his opponent.
sentences.chinese: 在他年轻时的一次决斗中他不幸杀死了对手。

sentences.english: So most states outlawed duelling in the early 19th century.
sentences.chinese: 因此，在19世纪初多数国家禁止决斗。

sentences.english: Jack duelled his opponent for hours.
sentences.chinese: 杰克与他对手决斗了数小时。

sentences.english: Dueling players may not use a Lightwell that they didn't create themselves.
sentences.chinese: 决斗玩家将无法使用非自己制造的光明之井。

sentences.english: For other aristocratic amusements-like gambling, dueling, and warfare.
sentences.chinese: 对于其他贵州娱乐活动像赌博，决斗和战争。

sentences.english: Silently kill your goals and defeat the guards in fierce duels.
sentences.chinese: 静静地杀死你的目标，打败守卫在激烈的决斗。

sentences.english: A skill guide has been added to the Arena.
Vader defeated the aged Jedi Knight in a lightsaber duel.
sentences.chinese: 维德在光剑决斗中击败了这位年迈的绝地武士。

sentences.english: I challenge you to a duel .
He brought a shepherd’s rules to the battlefield.
sentences.chinese: 他把牧羊的法则应用到了决斗场上。

sentences.english: Feeling were so intense that they fought a duel.
sentences.chinese: 双方情绪异常激烈，以至进行了一场决斗。

sentences.english: He threw down the gauntlet and I accepted his challenge.
sentences.chinese: 挑战书，并答应与他决斗。
一场决斗是不可避免的。

definition: to have a competition/to measure with one's hand or arm/to make a gesture of measuring
martial arts competition/tournament/to compete in a contest
to compare notes/to learn from one another/to swap pointers
elevated stage on which martial competitions or duels were held/arena/ring
to fight to one's last gasp
decisive battle/to fight a decisive battle/to fight for supremacy in ...
single-elimination open tournament (the winner stays on until he is himself defeated)
